{{ infobox football match | event = 1995 Asian Super Cup | team1 = [[Thai Farmers Bank F.C.|Thai Farmers Bank]] | team2 = [[Yokohama FlÃ¼gels]] | team1score = 3 | team2score = 4 | firstleg = First leg | team1score1 = 1 | team2score1 = 1 | date1 = July 29, 1995 | stadium1 = [[Suphanburi Province|Suphanburi]] | city1 = [[Thailand]] | attendance1 = | referee1 = | secondleg = Second leg | team1score2 = 2 | team2score2 = 3 | date2 = August 2, 1995 | stadium2 = [[Mitsuzawa Stadium]] | city2 = [[Yokohama]], [[Japan]] | attendance2 = | referee2 = | previous = | next = [[1996 Asian Super Cup|1996]] }} The '''1995 Asian Super Cup''' was the 1st [[Asian Super Cup]], a [[association football|football]] match played between the winners of the previous season's [[1994â95 Asian Club Championship#Champions|Asian Club Championship]] and [[1994â95 Asian Cup Winners' Cup#Champions|Asian Cup Winners Cup]] competitions. The 1995 competition was contested by [[Thai Farmers Bank FC|Thai Farmers Bank]] of [[Thailand]], who won the [[1994â95 Asian Club Championship]], and [[Yokohama FlÃ¼gels]] of [[Japan]], the winners of the [[1994â95 Asian Cup Winners' Cup]]. == Route to the Super Cup == === Thai Farmers Bank === {{details|1994â95 Asian Club Championship}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" |- !Opponents !Round !Score1 !Farmers Bank goalscorers |- |{{flagicon|IND}} [[Mohun Bagan AC|Mohun Bagan]] || Second round || 7–02 || ? |- |{{flagicon|CHN}} [[Liaoning FC|Liaoning]] || Quarterfinals || 2–0 || ? |- |{{flagicon|JPN}} [[Tokyo Verdy|Verdy Kawasaki]] || Quarterfinals || 1–2 || ? |- |{{flagicon|KOR}} [[Seongnam Ilhwa Chunma|Ilhwa Chunma]] || Quarterfinals || 0–1 || ? |- |{{flagicon|UZB}} [[FK Neftchy Farg'ona]] || Semifinals || 2–2 ([[Extra time|AET]], 3 [[Penalty shootout (association football)|PK]] 2) || ? |- |{{flagicon|QAT}} [[Al-Arabi SC (Qatar)|Al-Arabi]] || Final || 1–0 || [[Netipong Srithong-in]] {{goal|82}} |- |} 1Farmers Bank goals always recorded first.
2 The [[Asian Football Confederation|AFC]] ordered that 2nd leg was to be played in [[Malaysia]] due to a plague threat in [[India]], but [[Mohun Bagan]] objected to the ruling; they were ejected from the competition, fined $3000 and banned from AFC competitions for three years. === Yokohama FlÃ¼gels === {{details|1994â95 Asian Cup Winners' Cup}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" |- !Opponents !Round !Score1 !Yokohama goalscorers |- |{{flagicon|IND}} [[Kingfisher East Bengal FC|East Bengal]] || Second round || [[walkover|(w/o)]] || |- |{{flagicon|HKG}} [[Double Flower FA|Instant Dict]] || Quarterfinals || 4–3 || ? |- |{{flagicon|THA}} [[TOT FC|Telephone Org. Thailand]] || Semifinals || 4–2 || ? |- |{{flagicon|UAE}} [[Al-Shabab (UAE)|Al Shabab]] || Final || 2–1 || [[Watanabe]] {{goal|37}} {{goal|95}} |- |} 1Yokohama' goals always recorded first. == Game summary == {{TwoLegStart}} {{TwoLegResult| [[Thai Farmers Bank FC|Thai Farmers Bank]] | THA | 3-4 | '''[[Yokohama FlÃ¼gels]]''' | JPN | 1-1 | 2-3 |winner=2}} |} === First Game === {{footballbox |date = July 29, 1995 |team1 = [[Thai Farmers Bank FC|Thai Farmers Bank]] {{flagicon|THA}} |score = 1–1 |team2 = {{flagicon|JPN}} [[Yokohama FlÃ¼gels]] |goals1 = [[Netipong Srithong-in]] {{goal|88}} |goals2 = [[Zinho (footballer)|Zinho]] {{goal|76}} |stadium = [[Suphanburi Province|Suphanburi]], [[Thailand]] }} === Second Game === {{footballbox |date = August 2, 1995 |team1 = [[Yokohama FlÃ¼gels]] {{flagicon|JPN}} |score = 3–2 |team2 = {{flagicon|THA}} [[Thai Farmers Bank FC|Thai Farmers Bank]] |goals1 = [[Evair Aparecido Paulino|Evair]] {{goal|60}}
